category.name: NeoPixel
category.comment: Connect NeoPixel data wire to the GPIO pin you specify below
Use these blocks to create colors. RGB values go from 0 to 255
LED numbers start at 0. First LED is 0, second is 1, etc.

category.name: Character LCD
category.comment: Connect LCD via I2C using PCF8574 controller. SCL and SDA pins connect to ESP32
Row and column numbers start at 0. First position is (0,0)

block.comment: CLK=Clock, DIO=Data, CS=Chip Select. Count=number of connected matrix modules
Brightness: 0 (dim) to 15 (bright)
Set individual pixel: x and y from 0-7 for single matrix

button.text: Documentation and how to connect: ds1820
Documentation and how to connect: encoder

block.comment: For 180Â° servo motors. Connect signal wire to pin, red to 5V, brown to GND
For 360Â° continuous rotation servo. Connect signal wire to pin
Angle: 0-180 degrees. 90 is center position
Sweep servo back and forth. Delay in milliseconds
Move smoothly to angle. Speed: 1-20 (higher is faster)
Speed: 0-100%. Higher is faster
Turn off servo signal to save power and allow free movement
Turn on servo signal after detaching
Connect your stepper motor: IN1-IN4 to ESP32 GPIO pins. Use different Motor IDs (0-9) for multiple motors. 28BYJ-48 uses 2048 steps per revolution.
Rotate motor by angle: 90 degrees = quarter turn, 180 degrees = half turn, 360 degrees = full turn
Move by exact steps: 1 full rotation = steps per revolution. 28BYJ-48: 2048 steps = 360 degrees. Use for precise control.
Go to absolute position: 0 degrees = starting position. Motor remembers where it is. Great for returning to positions.
Choose easy speed presets: Very Slow = careful movements, Fast = quick actions
Set exact speed in RPM: RPM = Rotations Per Minute. 28BYJ-48: 1-15 RPM typical. Higher = faster (may skip steps)
Smooth rotation with acceleration: Smooth = gradual speed changes, Normal = standard movement, Quick = fast start and stop
WARNING: This blocks your code! Use only when you want continuous rotation. Put a Stop block to halt spinning.
Emergency stop: Halts motor immediately and turns off all coils
Fun dance pattern! Motor moves back and forth. Great for testing your setup.
Get current position in degrees. Returns number from 0 degrees onwards.
Check if motor is moving. Returns true or false.
Reset position to 0 degrees. Current position becomes new start.
Connect motor to L298N driver. IN1/IN2 control direction, EN controls speed
Speed: 0-100%
Run motor for specified seconds then stop

category.name: RTTTL Player
category.comment: Play famous melodies! Choose from pre-loaded popular songs.
Play your own RTTTL string! Format: name:settings:notes Example: MySong:d=4,o=5,b=140:8c,8d,8e
Play individual musical notes! Choose note, octave, and duration. Great for making your own melodies!
Set buzzer volume (0-100%). Lower values = quieter sound.

label.text: This block allows terminal/console access using bluetooth.
Send files to a Google Spreadsheet
No breadboard or sensors? Just simulate it!
Device should be connected to Internet
